Adjective: approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value
lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered
around the middle of a scale of evaluation
relating to or constituting the most frequent value in a distribution
relating to or constituting the middle value of an ordered set of values (or the average of the middle two in a set with an even number of value)
Noun: a statistic describing the location of a distribution
an intermediate scale value regarded as normal or usual
Verb: amount to or come to an average, without loss or gain
